meanings.definition: The classification of organisms in an ordered system that indicates natural relationships.
meanings.sent1: Scientists use taxonomies to organize different animals based on their similarities.
meanings.sent2: In biology, taxonomies help us understand how different species are related to each other.
meanings.sent3: The zookeeper joked that creating taxonomies for the animals was like solving a giant puzzle.
meanings.sent4: Exploring the taxonomies of the animal kingdom is like unraveling a complex web of connections.
meanings.sent5: Learning about taxonomies makes the world of living organisms seem more structured and interconnected.

meanings.definition: The practice of classifying things according to their natural relationships.
meanings.sent1: Librarians use taxonomies to organize books on the shelves for easy access.
meanings.sent2: In botany, taxonomies help botanists group plants based on their characteristics.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully compared creating taxonomies for recipes to solving a delicious puzzle.
meanings.sent4: Exploring the taxonomies of flavors is like discovering a hidden map of taste combinations.
meanings.sent5: Understanding taxonomies can make sorting and categorizing items feel more logical and efficient.
